revised_title: An Investigation into the Apex of the Leaf in Osmunda and Todea
tldr: The author examines the apex of the leaf in Osmunda and Todea species and discovers a three-sided, conical apical cell, differing from the typical two-sided cell found in other ferns. This finding suggests an intermediate developmental stage between ferns and other plant groups, such as Marathacece and Cycadece.
